comments.body:
üìù Walkthrough ## Walkthrough This pull request introduces a comprehensive file organization learning system ("The Learnings"), file tagging capabilities via AI, enhanced duplicate management with safe deletion, app-wide deeplink navigation, a new CLI tool, and refactored UI animations. It expands the codebase with new data models, pattern detection algorithms, a help system, and integrates these features across the application. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Summary | |---|---| | **Learnings Core Engine**
`Learnings/LearningsAnalyzer.swift`, `Learnings/RuleInducer.swift`, `Learnings/PatternMatcher.swift` | Introduces the core learning system: analyzer orchestrates rule induction and proposal generation; rule inducer learns patterns from labeled examples and example folders; pattern matcher detects date, filename, and folder-structure patterns. Provides async analysis with progress tracking, confidence metrics, and conflict detection. | | **Learnings Data Models**
`Learnings/LearningsModels.swift`, `Learnings/LearningsProject.swift` | Defines all data structures for the Learnings feature: labeled examples, inferred rules, proposed mappings with alternatives, confidence levels, risk assessment, analysis results, and persistence models. Includes JobManifest for tracking organization jobs and BackupMode options. Codable and Sendable for cross-process safety. | | **Learnings Management**
`Learnings/LearningsManager.swift`, `CLI/LearningsCLI.swift` | LearningsManager: SwiftUI-integrated controller for project lifecycle, analysis, mapping acceptance/editing, and apply/rollback workflows. CLI: New command-line interface with subcommands for init-project, add-example, analyze, apply, rollback, export-rules, list-projects with argument parsing and persistent storage. | | **File Tagging System**
`AI/SystemPrompt.swift`, `AI/ResponseParser.swift`, `Models/FolderSuggestion.swift` | Extends AI prompts and response parsing to handle file tagging; files now include 1‚Äì3 Finder-compatible tags. ResponseParser decodes tags from JSON, stores in FileEntry, and maps tags via FileTagMapping. FolderSuggestion provides tag lookup and accumulation methods. | | **File Tagging Operations**
`FileSystem/FileSystemManager.swift`, `Models/AIConfig.swift` | FileSystemManager adds tagFiles operation type, OperationMetadata tracking original/new tags, and applyOrganization integration with enableTagging flag for conditional tagging. AIConfig adds enableFileTagging boolean to control tag application. | | **Duplicate Management**
`Models/DuplicateSettings.swift`, `FileSystem/FileSystemManager.swift` | New DuplicateSettings model and DuplicateSettingsManager for persistence; DuplicateRestorationManager enables safe deletion with backup tracking and restore capability. Adds RestorableDuplicate types to history for audit trail. | | **Deeplink Navigation**
`Utilities/DeeplinkHandler.swift`, `FileOrganizerApp.swift` | New DeeplinkHandler parses fileorganizer:// URLs into destinations (organize, duplicates, learnings, settings, help, history, health). App integrates handler via StateObject and onOpenURL to update navigation state and directory context. Includes URL generation for linking. | | **UI: Help & About**
`Views/HelpView.swift`, `Views/AboutView.swift` | Comprehensive in-app help system with HelpSection enum covering all features, split-view navigation, and detailed content sections. AboutView displays version, commit, and action buttons with material background. | | **UI: Learnings Wizard**
`Views/LearningsView.swift` | Multi-step wizard UI for Learnings: Welcome, Add Folders, Add Examples, Analyze, Apply. Includes project management, file import, progress tracking, confidence filters, backup options, and rollback. Integrates ProjectListSheet for selecting existing projects. | | **UI: Duplicates & Settings**
`Views/DuplicatesView.swift`, `Views/DuplicateSettingsView.swift` | Enhanced duplicates view with directory selection, safe deletion toggle, and settings integration. New DuplicateSettingsView provides controls for min file size, scan depth, keep strategy, semantic duplicate threshold, and safe deletion options. | | **UI: Persona Management**
`Views/PersonaPickerView.swift`, `Views/PersonaEditorView.swift`, `Models/CustomPersona.swift` | Custom persona creation and editing UI with icon picker and prompt template insertion. CustomPersona model with persistence via CustomPersonaStore; integrated into PersonaPickerView with separate Built-in and Custom sections. | | **UI: Animation Refactoring**
`Views/AnalysisView.swift`, `Views/OrganizeView.swift`, `Views/ExclusionRulesView.swift`, `Views/WatchedFoldersView.swift` | Removed excessive micro-animations (bounceTap, pulsing, scaling, hover effects) and animation state across multiple views; UI renders more statically while maintaining core functionality and control flow. | | **UI: Navigation & Results**
`Views/ContentView.swift`, `Views/AppCommands.swift`, `Views/OrganizationResultView.swift` | Added Learnings nav item and case to AppView. AppCommands expanded with Learnings view, persistent window controllers for About/Help, export workflow (CSV/JSON/HTML), and deleteUsageData. OrganizationResultView now displays GenerationStatsView when available. | | **UI: Workspace & History**
`Views/WorkspaceHealthView.swift`, `Views/HistoryView.swift` | WorkspaceHealth adds new cleanup opportunities (very old files, empty folders, broken symlinks) with private detection helpers and onTakeAction navigation. HistoryView adds Space Saved dashboard stat, duplicatesCleanup status handling, and restore flow for deleted items. | | **AI & Models**
`AI/OpenAIClient.swift`, `AI/AppleFoundationModelClient.swift`, `AI/AIClientFactory.swift`, `AI/AIClientProtocol.swift` | Added timing instrumentation and GenerationStats (duration, TPS, TTFT, token estimates) to non-streaming and Apple Foundation paths; stats attached to returned OrganizationPlan. Minor formatting updates to client files. | | **Models & History**
`Models/OrganizationPlan.swift`, `Models/OrganizationHistory.swift`, `Models/FileItem.swift`, `Models/WorkspaceHealth.swift`, `Models/OrganizationPersona.swift`, `Models/GenerationStats.swift`, `Models/ExclusionRule.swift` | GenerationStats moved from separate file to OrganizationPlan. OrganizationHistory extended with duplicatesCleanup status, RestorableDuplicate type, recovered space tracking. FileItem adds modificationDate/lastAccessDate. WorkspaceHealth adds veryOldFiles/emptyFolders/brokenSymlinks cases with detection logic. PersonaManager adds selectedCustomPersonaId tracking. | | **Build & Package**
`Package.swift`, `Makefile`, `build.sh`, `.gitignore` | Package.swift adds learnings executable target and updates exclusions; Makefile adds cli/install-cli targets; build.sh auto-generates commit.txt from Git; .gitignore adds TestResults.xcresult/ and Logs/. | | **Utilities**
`Utilities/DeeplinkHandler.swift`, `Utilities/BuildInfo.swift`, `Utilities/Constants.swift`, `Utilities/Extensions.swift`, `Utilities/KeychainManager.swift`, `Utilities/AnimationUtilities.swift` | BuildInfo added for version/commit/build tracking; Constants absorbs animation utilities (HapticFeedbackManager, PageTransitionStyle, loading indicators, button styles, transitions); AnimationUtilities removed. DeeplinkHandler as separate file. Minor formatting on Extensions/Keycahin. | | **Testing**
`Tests/CustomPersonaTests.swift`, `Tests/DeeplinkTests.swift`, `Tests/DuplicateSettingsTests.swift`, `Tests/ResponseParserTests.swift`, `Tests/RuleInducerTests.swift` | New comprehensive test suites for custom personas, deeplinks, duplicate settings, file tagging in responses, and rule induction algorithms covering pattern matching, categorization, folder analysis, and incremental updates. | | **Documentation**
`HELP.md`, `README.md`, `Resources/commit.txt` | New HELP.md with feature documentation and workflows; README updated with macOS version and new feature bullets; commit.txt file added for version tracking. | | **File System Cleanup**
`FileSystem/DirectoryScanner.swift`, `Organizer/FileOrganizationValidator.swift`, `Organizer/FolderOrganizer.swift`, `Organizer/PreviewManager.swift`, `Views/GenerationStatsView.swift`, `Views/TimelineView.swift`, `Views/PreviewView.swift`, `Views/CanvasPreviewView.swift`, `Views/SettingsView.swift` | Minor trailing newline additions and animation removals across multiple files. FolderOrganizer/PreviewView updated to pass enableTagging parameter. SettingsView adds File Tagging toggle and AppState integration. GenerationStatsView removed (functionality moved to OrganizationResultView). | ## Sequence Diagrams ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant LearningsView participant LearningsManager participant LearningsAnalyzer participant RuleInducer participant FileSystemManager participant LearningsProjectStore User->>LearningsView: Create Project LearningsView->>LearningsManager: createProject(name, rootPaths) LearningsManager->>LearningsProjectStore: save(project) LearningsProjectStore-->>LearningsManager: ‚úì User->>LearningsView: Add Example Folders LearningsView->>LearningsManager: addExampleFolder(path) LearningsManager->>LearningsManager: Update currentProject User->>LearningsView: Analyze LearningsView->>LearningsManager: analyze() LearningsManager->>LearningsAnalyzer: analyze(project) par Phase: Learning Patterns LearningsAnalyzer->>RuleInducer: induceRules(examples, folders) RuleInducer-->>LearningsAnalyzer: [InferredRule] and Phase: Scan & Propose LearningsAnalyzer->>FileSystemManager: scanDirectory() FileSystemManager-->>LearningsAnalyzer: [FileURL] LearningsAnalyzer->>LearningsAnalyzer: proposeMapping(per file) end LearningsAnalyzer-->>LearningsManager: LearningsAnalysisResult LearningsManager->>LearningsManager: Update UI & lastResult LearningsView-->>User: Display Proposals User->>LearningsView: Apply Mappings LearningsView->>LearningsManager: applyMappings(backupDirectory, onlyHighConfidence) LearningsManager->>FileSystemManager: applyOrganization(plan, enableTagging: true) FileSystemManager->>FileSystemManager: moveFiles + tagFiles + removeEmptyFolders FileSystemManager-->>LearningsManager: [FileOperation] LearningsManager->>LearningsProjectStore: addJob(manifest) LearningsProjectStore-->>LearningsManager: ‚úì LearningsView-->>User: Apply Complete ``` ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant FileOrganizerApp participant DeeplinkHandler participant AppState participant NavigationView User->>FileOrganizerApp: Open deeplink URL FileOrganizerApp->>DeeplinkHandler: handle(url) DeeplinkHandler->>DeeplinkHandler: Parse URL DeeplinkHandler->>DeeplinkHandler: Update pendingDestination alt Organize with Path DeeplinkHandler->>AppState: selectedDirectory = path DeeplinkHandler->>AppState: currentView = .organize else Learnings with Project DeeplinkHandler->>AppState: currentView = .learnings else Help with Section DeeplinkHandler->>AppState: showHelp(section) else Other Destination DeeplinkHandler->>AppState: currentView = destination end AppState-->>NavigationView: Publish updated state NavigationView->>NavigationView: Update active view NavigationView-->>User: Display destination User->>NavigationView: Interaction complete FileOrganizerApp->>DeeplinkHandler: clearPending() ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 5 (Critical) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~120 minutes **Rationale**: This PR introduces substantial new features (Learnings system with pattern induction, file tagging, duplicate safe deletion, deeplinks, CLI) spanning 40+ modified/new files with dense algorithmic logic (rule induction, pattern matching, confidence scoring), complex state management (multi-step wizards, project persistence), integration across multiple subsystems, and modified core file operations. The heterogeneity of changes (data models, algorithms, UI, CLI, system integration) combined with high logic density and cross-feature dependencies demands comprehensive review of each cohort's correctness, error handling, and integration points. ## Poem > üê∞ *Patterns learned from folders old,* > *Rules discovered, stories told,* > *Files now tagged, safe from loss,* > *Deep links guide us, smooth the cross,* > *Learning systems, wise and brave‚Äî* > *A rabbit's dream, files now saved!* üåü
## Pre-merge checks and finishing touches
‚ùå Failed checks (2 warnings) | Check name | Status | Explanation | Resolution | | :----------------: | :--------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | Description check | ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning | The description covers major features but is incomplete and contains duplication. Required sections like 'Related Issues', 'Type of Change', and 'Verification Results' are missing. | Add missing template sections: link related issues, specify change type (New feature), and confirm tests passed and functionality verified. Remove duplicate lines. | | Docstring Coverage | ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning | Docstring coverage is 51.01% which is insufficient. The required threshold is 80.00%. | You can run `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to improve docstring coverage. |
‚úÖ Passed checks (1 passed) | Check name | Status | Explanation | | :---------: | :------- | :-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Title check | ‚úÖ Passed | The title accurately summarizes the main changes: adding Learnings engine, Custom Personas, and CLI tooling to the organization engine. |
‚ú® Finishing touches - [ ] üìù Generate docstrings
üß™ Generate unit tests (beta) - [ ] Create PR with unit tests - [ ] Post copyable unit tests in a comment - [ ] Commit unit tests in branch `feature/enhanced-organization-and-docs`

‚ù§Ô∏è Share - [X](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A&url=https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [Mastodon](https://mastodon.social/share?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai) - [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/submit?title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&text=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai&mini=true&title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&summary=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code)

Generating unit tests... This may take up to 20 minutes.

Greptile Summary

- Implements a major File Organizer engine enhancement adding The Learnings feature (5-step wizard for training AI organization from examples), Custom Personas editor, file tagging support, app-wide deeplinks, CLI tooling, and comprehensive duplicate detection with restoration capabilities - Refactors UI across the application by removing complex animations and custom styling in favor of simpler, more maintainable SwiftUI implementations while adding new views like `LearningsView`, `PersonaEditorView`, and `AboutView` - Expands data models and infrastructure with new components including `LearningsManager`, `CustomPersona`, `DuplicateSettings`, `DeeplinkHandler`, performance tracking via `GenerationStats`, and enhanced file system operations with tagging support

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | `Learnings/PatternMatcher.swift` | New file with missing dependency on undefined `FileCategory.from(extension:)` method | | `Models/OrganizationPersona.swift` | Adds `selectedCustomPersonaId` property but lacks persistence implementation for the custom persona selection state | | `AI/SystemPrompt.swift` | Modifies AI system prompt to require file tagging but changes JSON structure in a potentially breaking way for existing AI responses | | `Utilities/AnimationUtilities.swift` | Complete removal of 500+ lines of animation infrastructure that may break existing UI components depending on these utilities | | `Views/PersonaEditorView.swift` | New editor view references undefined `personaIconOptions` constant and calls potentially non-existent `update` method on `CustomPersona` |

Confidence score: 2/5

- This PR introduces significant new functionality but contains several implementation gaps and potential breaking changes that need resolution before merging - Score lowered due to missing dependencies in `PatternMatcher.swift`, incomplete persistence in `OrganizationPersona.swift`, undefined references in `PersonaEditorView.swift`, and removal of critical animation utilities without confirming dependent code compatibility - Pay close attention to `Learnings/PatternMatcher.swift`, `Models/OrganizationPersona.swift`, `Views/PersonaEditorView.swift`, `AI/SystemPrompt.swift`, and verify that removing `Utilities/AnimationUtilities.swift` doesn't break existing UI components

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant ContentView participant OrganizeView participant FolderOrganizer participant AIClient participant FileSystemManager participant PreviewView User->>ContentView: "Select directory and navigate to Organize" ContentView->>OrganizeView: "Display organize interface" User->>OrganizeView: "Click 'Start Organization'" OrganizeView->>FolderOrganizer: "organize(directory, customPrompt)" FolderOrganizer->>DirectoryScanner: "scanDirectory(url)" DirectoryScanner-->>FolderOrganizer: "Return file list" FolderOrganizer->>AIClient: "analyze(files, instructions, personaPrompt)" AIClient-->>FolderOrganizer: "Return OrganizationPlan" FolderOrganizer->>FileOrganizationValidator: "validate(plan, baseURL)" FolderOrganizer->>OrganizeView: "Update state to .ready" OrganizeView->>PreviewView: "Display preview with plan" User->>PreviewView: "Click 'Apply Organization'" PreviewView->>FolderOrganizer: "apply(baseURL)" FolderOrganizer->>FileSystemManager: "applyOrganization(plan, baseURL)" FileSystemManager-->>FolderOrganizer: "Return operations list" FolderOrganizer->>OrganizationHistory: "addEntry(historyEntry)" FolderOrganizer->>OrganizeView: "Update state to .completed" OrganizeView->>OrganizationResultView: "Show completion status" ```

reviews.body:
## Pull request overview This PR implements a comprehensive enhancement to the FileOrganizer engine with multiple major features and improvements: **Purpose**: Add example-based AI training capabilities, custom organization personas, enhanced duplicate detection, and automation support through deeplinks and CLI. **Key Changes**: - **The Learnings Engine**: A new 5-step wizard for training AI organization using examples with backup/rollback support - **Custom Personas**: Full CRUD system for specialized AI organization profiles - **Enhanced Duplicates**: Fine-grained settings, safe deletion with restoration, and history tracking - **Deeplink Support**: `fileorganizer://` URL scheme for app-wide navigation and automation - **CLI Tool**: Terminal-based `learnings` command for project management - **UI Polish**: Removed excessive animations, consolidated test connection UI, added file tagging support ### Reviewed changes Copilot reviewed 71 out of 72 changed files in this pull request and generated no comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | build.sh | Auto-generates commit.txt from git for build tracking | | Package.swift | Adds LearningsCLI executable target and excludes build artifacts | | Makefile | Adds CLI build and install commands | | Views/LearningsView.swift | New 821-line wizard UI for The Learnings feature | | Views/HelpView.swift | New 868-line comprehensive in-app help system | | Views/PersonaEditorView.swift | New editor for creating/editing custom personas | | Views/DuplicateSettingsView.swift | New settings UI for duplicate detection configuration | | Views/SettingsView.swift | Reorganized with navigation shortcuts, consolidated test connections | | Views/DuplicatesView.swift | Enhanced with safe deletion, independent directory selection | | Views/WorkspaceHealthView.swift | Added navigation to organize view from opportunities | | Views/*View.swift | Removed excessive animations (.bounceTap, .animatedAppearance, etc.) | | Models/CustomPersona.swift | New model for user-created personas with store | | Models/DuplicateSettings.swift | New settings model with KeepStrategy enum | | Models/OrganizationHistory.swift | Extended with duplicate cleanup tracking and restoration | | Learnings/*.swift | New pattern matching and rule induction engine | | Utilities/DeeplinkHandler.swift | New deeplink URL scheme handler | | Utilities/BuildInfo.swift | New build information utility | | Tests/*.swift | New test files for all major features | | AI/SystemPrompt.swift | Enhanced with file tagging instructions |
--- üí° Add Copilot custom instructions for smarter, more guided reviews. Learn how to get started.

**Actionable comments posted: 16** > [!NOTE] > Due to the large number of review comments, Critical, Major severity comments were prioritized as inline comments. > [!CAUTION] > Some comments are outside the diff and can‚Äôt be posted inline due to platform limitations. > > > >
> ‚ö†Ô∏è Outside diff range comments (2)
> >
> FinderExtension/FileOrganizerActionExtension.swift (1)
> > `59-60`: **Remove duplicate comment.** > > Line 59 and line 60 both contain the identical comment "Fallback: try to open the app bundle"‚Äîone should be removed. > >
> üîé Proposed fix > > ```diff > } else { > // Fallback: try to open the app bundle > - // Fallback: try to open the app bundle > let bundleURL = Bundle.main.bundleURL.deletingLastPathComponent().deletingLastPathComponent().deletingLastPathComponent() > NSWorkspace.shared.open(bundleURL) > } > ``` >
> >
>
> Views/TimelineView.swift (1)
> > `258-260`: **SelectedEntryCard incorrectly marks any non-undone entry as "Current".** > > The `isCurrentState` property checks only `!entry.isUndone`, but the actual current state should be the most recent non-undone entry. Since users can select any historical entry in the timeline, an older entry that was never undone would incorrectly display "Current" alongside the true current state. > > Pass `isCurrentState` explicitly to `SelectedEntryCard` based on whether the entry is the first in the filtered list (index 0) and not undone: > > ```swift > SelectedEntryCard( > entry: filteredEntries[selectedIndex], > isCurrentState: selectedIndex == 0 && !filteredEntries[selectedIndex].isUndone, > onRestore: onRestore > ) > ``` > > Then update `SelectedEntryCard` to accept this parameter instead of computing it. > >
> >
üü° Minor comments (19)
Views/AppCommands.swift-411-433 (1)
`411-433`: **HTML content is not escaped.** User-controlled content (folder names, file names, paths, reasoning) is interpolated directly into HTML without escaping. Characters like `<`, `>`, `&`, and quotes will break the HTML structure or could enable XSS if the exported file is viewed in a browser.
üîé Suggested fix - add an HTML escape helper ```swift private func htmlEscape(_ string: String) -> String { string .replacingOccurrences(of: "&", with: "&") .replacingOccurrences(of: "<", with: "<") .replacingOccurrences(of: ">", with: ">") .replacingOccurrences(of: "\"", with: """) } ``` Then use it when interpolating user content: ```diff -
üìÇ \(suggestion.folderName)
+
üìÇ \(htmlEscape(suggestion.folderName))
``` Apply similarly to `suggestion.reasoning`, `file.displayName`, `file.path`, `newName`, and tag values.
> Committable suggestion skipped: line range outside the PR's diff.
Views/AppCommands.swift-305-305 (1)
`305-305`: **CSV fields with special characters are not properly escaped.** The `originalName` and `destination` fields are not quoted, which will corrupt the CSV if filenames or paths contain commas, quotes, or newlines. Only `reasoning` and `tags` are quoted.
üîé Suggested fix ```diff - csv += "\(originalName),\"\(originalPath)\",\(destination),\(reasoning),\"\(tags)\"\n" + let escapedName = "\"" + originalName.replacingOccurrences(of: "\"", with: "\"\"") + "\"" + let escapedDest = "\"" + destination.replacingOccurrences(of: "\"", with: "\"\"") + "\"" + csv += "\(escapedName),\"\(originalPath)\",\(escapedDest),\(reasoning),\"\(tags)\"\n" ```
Views/DuplicateSettingsView.swift-90-100 (1)
`90-100`: **Inconsistent extension format guidance between include and exclude fields.** The include placeholder shows `jpg, png` (no dots) while the exclude placeholder shows `.DS_Store, .localized` (with dots). This inconsistency could confuse users and lead to mismatched filtering behavior if the scanning logic expects a specific format. Consider normalizing extensions during parsing (e.g., always strip or always add leading dots) or aligning the placeholder text.
Views/DuplicatesView.swift-225-228 (1)
`225-228`: **Duplicate MARK comment.** The `// MARK: - Header` comment appears twice consecutively. Remove the duplicate.
üîé Proposed fix ```diff // MARK: - Header -// MARK: - Header - struct DuplicatesHeader: View { ```
Views/DuplicatesView.swift-273-278 (1)
`273-278`: **Duplicate view modifiers applied to the same view.** Lines 273-274 and 276-277 apply identical `.opacity` and `.offset` modifiers. This appears to be a copy/paste error that applies the modifiers twice.
üîé Proposed fix - remove duplicates ```diff } .opacity(appeared ? 1 : 0) .offset(y: appeared ? 0 : 10) - .opacity(appeared ? 1 : 0) - .offset(y: appeared ? 0 : 10) - Spacer() ```
Tests/DuplicateSettingsTests.swift-89-93 (1)
`89-93`: **Incomplete coverage of KeepStrategy descriptions.** Only 3 of 5 cases are tested. Add assertions for `.smallest` and `.shortestPath` to ensure all descriptions are non-empty.
üîé Proposed fix ```diff func testKeepStrategyDescriptions() { XCTAssertFalse(KeepStrategy.newest.description.isEmpty) XCTAssertFalse(KeepStrategy.oldest.description.isEmpty) XCTAssertFalse(KeepStrategy.largest.description.isEmpty) + XCTAssertFalse(KeepStrategy.smallest.description.isEmpty) + XCTAssertFalse(KeepStrategy.shortestPath.description.isEmpty) } ```
Tests/DuplicateSettingsTests.swift-53-77 (1)
`53-77`: **Incomplete round-trip verification in Codable test.** The test only verifies 5 of 9 properties after encoding/decoding. Missing assertions for `excludeExtensions`, `enableSafeDeletion`, `autoStartScan`, and `includeSemanticDuplicates` could miss regressions in Codable conformance.
üîé Proposed fix - add missing assertions ```diff XCTAssertEqual(decoded.minFileSize, original.minFileSize) XCTAssertEqual(decoded.maxScanDepth, original.maxScanDepth) XCTAssertEqual(decoded.includeExtensions, original.includeExtensions) + XCTAssertEqual(decoded.excludeExtensions, original.excludeExtensions) XCTAssertEqual(decoded.defaultKeepStrategy, original.defaultKeepStrategy) + XCTAssertEqual(decoded.enableSafeDeletion, original.enableSafeDeletion) + XCTAssertEqual(decoded.autoStartScan, original.autoStartScan) + XCTAssertEqual(decoded.includeSemanticDuplicates, original.includeSemanticDuplicates) XCTAssertEqual(decoded.semanticSimilarityThreshold, original.semanticSimilarityThreshold) ```
Utilities/BuildInfo.swift-93-119 (1)
`93-119`: **Consider using PATH-based git lookup instead of hardcoded path.** Line 95 hardcodes the git executable path as `/usr/bin/git`. While this works for Xcode command-line tools, it won't work if git is installed via Homebrew (`/usr/local/bin/git` or `/opt/homebrew/bin/git`) or other package managers.
üîé Recommended fix Use the shell's PATH to locate git, or check multiple known locations: ```diff private static func runGitCommand(in directory: String) -> String? { + // Try to find git in common locations + let gitPaths = [ + "/usr/bin/git", + "/usr/local/bin/git", + "/opt/homebrew/bin/git" + ] + + guard let gitPath = gitPaths.first(where: { FileManager.default.fileExists(atPath: $0) }) else { + return nil + } + let process = Process() - process.executableURL = URL(fileURLWithPath: "/usr/bin/git") + process.executableURL = URL(fileURLWithPath: gitPath) process.arguments = ["rev-parse", "HEAD"] process.currentDirectoryURL = URL(fileURLWithPath: directory) ``` Alternatively, use `/usr/bin/env git` if Process supports it, which respects the PATH environment variable.
README.md-5-5 (1)
`5-5`: **Clarify the macOS version requirement.** The badge indicates macOS 14.0+ as the minimum version, but the Prerequisites section (line 37) states "macOS 13.0 or later." Additionally, the Features section (line 25) specifies that Apple Foundation Models require macOS 15+. Ensure consistency across the badge, prerequisites, and feature requirements, or clarify which versions are needed for core functionality versus optional features.
Views/SettingsView.swift-456-458 (1)
`456-458`: **Remove duplicate padding modifier.** Line 457 has a duplicate `.padding(.vertical, 4)` modifier that appears to be a copy-paste error.
üîé Proposed fix ```diff .padding(.vertical, 4) - .padding(.vertical, 4) .accessibilityIdentifier("DuplicatesToggle") ```
HELP.md-399-399 (1)
`399-399`: **Update macOS version requirement to 15.1+.** The documentation incorrectly states "macOS 26+" when the actual requirement is macOS Sequoia 15.1 or later (with Apple silicon M1 or later). Update line 399 to reflect the correct version.
Utilities/Constants.swift-232-232 (1)
`232-232`: **Unused closure parameters should be replaced with `_`.** Per SwiftLint, the `oldValue` parameter in these `onChange` closures is unused and should be replaced with `_` for clarity.
üîé Proposed fix Line 232: ```diff - .onChange(of: isLoading) { oldValue, newValue in + .onChange(of: isLoading) { _, newValue in ``` Line 256: ```diff - .onChange(of: isLoading) { oldValue, newValue in + .onChange(of: isLoading) { _, newValue in ``` Line 515: ```diff - .onChange(of: configuration.isPressed) { oldValue, newValue in + .onChange(of: configuration.isPressed) { _, newValue in ```
Also applies to: 256-256, 515-515
AI/SystemPrompt.swift-28-32 (1)

Learnings/LearningsProject.swift-210-210 (1)
`210-210`: **Project name to filename conversion may not round-trip correctly.** The current approach has two issues: 1. `save`/`load`/`delete` use `replacingOccurrences(of: " ", with: "_").lowercased()` 2. `listProjects` uses `replacingOccurrences(of: "_", with: " ").capitalized` This won't correctly round-trip names like "My_Project" (underscore in original name) or "iOS Photos" (would become "Ios Photos" after capitalized).
üîé Suggested fix using slug-based approach Consider storing the original project name in the JSON itself and using a consistent slug for filenames, or use URL-safe encoding: ```diff public func listProjects() async throws -> [String] { try ensureDirectoryExists() let contents = try fileManager.contentsOfDirectory(at: projectsDirectory, includingPropertiesForKeys: nil) - return contents - .filter { $0.pathExtension == "json" } - .map { $0.deletingPathExtension().lastPathComponent.replacingOccurrences(of: "_", with: " ").capitalized } + // Load each project to get the actual name from the stored data + var names: [String] = [] + for url in contents where url.pathExtension == "json" { + if let data = try? Data(contentsOf: url), + let project = try? JSONDecoder().decode(LearningsProject.self, from: data) { + names.append(project.name) + } + } + return names } ```

Learnings/LearningsManager.swift-281-327 (1)
`281-327`: **Rollback doesn't update job status to `.rolledBack`.** After a successful rollback, the job's status should be updated to `.rolledBack` and the project saved. Currently, the job remains with its original status (likely `.completed`), which could cause confusion in the UI or allow re-rollback attempts.
üîé Suggested fix ```diff public func rollbackJob(jobId: String) async { guard let project = currentProject else { error = "No project loaded" return } - guard let job = project.jobHistory.first(where: { $0.id == jobId }) else { + guard let jobIndex = project.jobHistory.firstIndex(where: { $0.id == jobId }) else { error = "Job not found: \(jobId)" return } + + let job = project.jobHistory[jobIndex] isApplying = true applyProgress = 0 error = nil // ... existing rollback logic ... isApplying = false applyProgress = 1.0 + // Update job status + currentProject?.jobHistory[jobIndex].status = .rolledBack + await saveProject() + if failCount > 0 { self.error = "Rolled back \(successCount) files, \(failCount) failed" } } ```

Views/AppCommands.swift (4)

SwiftUI menus don't support styled text labels this way ‚Äî the text may appear as a disabled menu item or be ignored entirely. Consider removing these lines or using a `Divider()` with a comment if visual separation is the intent. macOS menus don't natively support section headers within command groups.

JSONEncoder().encode(settings) { + do { + let encoded = try JSONEncoder().encode(settings) userDefaults.set(encoded, forKey: storageKey) + } catch { + // Log encoding failure for debugging + print("Failed to encode DuplicateSettings: \(error)") } } ```

If the user clicks "Cancel", the value is reset to `true`. This causes a brief flash where safe deletion is disabled, and the toggle animation may appear janky. Consider using a local state to track the pending change and only apply it upon confirmation.

"Connected" : "Failed", systemImage: status.contains("Success") ? "checkmark.circle.fill" : "xmark.circle.fill" ) .foregroundColor(status.contains("Success") ? .green : .red) .font(.caption) .transition(.scale(scale: 0.8).combined(with: .opacity)) } } if let status = testConnectionStatus, !status.contains("Success") { Text(status) .font(.caption) .foregroundColor(.red) .transition(.opacity.combined(with: .move(edge: .top))) } } } } ``` Then use it in each section: ```swift // OpenAI-compatible section TestConnectionButton( isTestingConnection: isTestingConnection, testConnectionStatus: testConnectionStatus, iconName: "network", isAvailable: viewModel.config.provider.isAvailable, accessibilityId: "TestConnectionButton", onTest: testConnection ) // Ollama section TestConnectionButton( isTestingConnection: isTestingConnection, testConnectionStatus: testConnectionStatus, iconName: "network", isAvailable: true, accessibilityId: "OllamaTestConnectionButton", onTest: testConnection ) // Apple FM section TestConnectionButton( isTestingConnection: isTestingConnection, testConnectionStatus: testConnectionStatus, iconName: "brain", isAvailable: viewModel.config.provider.isAvailable, accessibilityId: "AppleFMTestConnectionButton", onTest: testConnection ) ```

Tests/CustomPersonaTests.swift (1)
`30-55`: **Consider removing the sleep for more reliable tests.** Using `Thread.sleep` to ensure timestamp differences makes tests slower and can be flaky. Consider using dependency injection with a controllable clock/date provider, or simply verify that `modifiedAt` is updated without checking it's strictly greater (which is implicitly guaranteed by the implementation setting it to `Date()`).
Alternative approach without sleep ```diff func testCustomPersonaUpdate() { var persona = CustomPersona( name: "Original", icon: "folder", description: "Original description", promptModifier: "Original prompt" ) let originalModified = persona.modifiedAt - // Small delay to ensure time difference - Thread.sleep(forTimeInterval: 0.01) - persona.update( name: "Updated", icon: "star", description: "Updated description", prompt: "Updated prompt" ) XCTAssertEqual(persona.name, "Updated") XCTAssertEqual(persona.icon, "star") XCTAssertEqual(persona.description, "Updated description") XCTAssertEqual(persona.promptModifier, "Updated prompt") - XCTAssertGreaterThan(persona.modifiedAt, originalModified) + XCTAssertNotEqual(persona.modifiedAt, originalModified) } ``` Note: Since `update()` sets `modifiedAt = Date()`, it will always differ from the pre-update value unless the test runs impossibly fast.

Models/CustomPersona.swift (2)
`81-93`: **Silent failure on encode/decode errors may cause data loss.** Both `loadPersonas()` and `savePersonas()` silently swallow errors. If decoding fails (e.g., due to schema changes), users lose all their custom personas without any indication. Similarly, encoding failures silently discard changes.
üîé Proposed fix Consider logging errors or surfacing them via a published error property: ```diff + @Published public var loadError: Error? + private func loadPersonas() { guard let data = userDefaults.data(forKey: storageKey), - let decoded = try? JSONDecoder().decode([CustomPersona].self, from: data) else { - return + let decoded = try? JSONDecoder().decode([CustomPersona].self, from: data) else { + #if DEBUG + if userDefaults.data(forKey: storageKey) != nil { + print("Warning: Failed to decode custom personas") + } + #endif + return } customPersonas = decoded } private func savePersonas() { - if let encoded = try? JSONEncoder().encode(customPersonas) { - userDefaults.set(encoded, forKey: storageKey) + do { + let encoded = try JSONEncoder().encode(customPersonas) + userDefaults.set(encoded, forKey: storageKey) + } catch { + #if DEBUG + print("Warning: Failed to encode custom personas: \(error)") + #endif } } ```

Learnings/LearningsAnalyzer.swift (2)
`128-156`: **Regex compilation in hot loop impacts performance.** `NSRegularExpression` is compiled fresh for each rule on every file. For large file sets and many rules, this creates significant overhead.
üîé Proposed fix Pre-compile regexes before the mapping loop: ```diff + // Pre-compile regexes for rules + private func compileRuleRegexes(_ rules: [InferredRule]) -> [(rule: InferredRule, regex: NSRegularExpression)] { + rules.compactMap { rule in + guard let regex = try? NSRegularExpression(pattern: rule.pattern) else { return nil } + return (rule, regex) + } + } + public func proposeMapping( for fileURL: URL, - using rules: [InferredRule], + using compiledRules: [(rule: InferredRule, regex: NSRegularExpression)], rootPath: String ) async -> ProposedMapping { let filename = fileURL.lastPathComponent ... - for rule in rules { - if let regex = try? NSRegularExpression(pattern: rule.pattern), - regex.firstMatch(in: filename, range: NSRange(filename.startIndex..., in: filename)) != nil { + for (rule, regex) in compiledRules { + if regex.firstMatch(in: filename, range: NSRange(filename.startIndex..., in: filename)) != nil { ```
--- `222-224`: **Fallback to current date may cause unexpected file organization.** When `PatternMatcher.extractDate` returns `nil`, the code falls back to `Date()` (current date). This could silently misorganize files that have no date in their filename but have a creation/modification date that would be more appropriate. Consider using file system metadata as a secondary fallback before defaulting to current date.
Views/LearningsView.swift (1)
`281-281`: **Using array index as `id` in `ForEach` can cause UI glitches.** Lines 281 and 353 use `Array(paths.enumerated())` with `id: \.offset`. When items are removed, the remaining items get new indices, potentially causing SwiftUI to misidentify views and display incorrect data or animations.
üîé Proposed fix Use the path itself as the identifier (assuming paths are unique): ```diff - ForEach(Array(paths.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, path in + ForEach(Array(paths.enumerated()), id: \.element) { index, path in ``` Or better, if the model can be changed, use `Identifiable` paths.

Learnings/PatternMatcher.swift (1)
`61-89`: **`DateFormatter` instantiation in extraction loop is expensive.** `DateFormatter` creation is costly. In `extractDate(from:)`, a new formatter is created for each pattern check. If called frequently (e.g., for thousands of files), this impacts performance.
üîé Proposed fix Use static cached formatters: ```diff + // MARK: - Cached Formatters + + private static let imgDateFormatter: DateFormatter = { + let f = DateFormatter() + f.dateFormat = "yyyyMMdd_HHmmss" + return f + }() + + private static let isoDateFormatter: DateFormatter = { + let f = DateFormatter() + f.dateFormat = "yyyy-MM-dd" + return f + }() + public static func extractDate(from filename: String) -> Date? { let name = (filename as NSString).deletingPathExtension // Try IMG/VID pattern: YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS if let match = name.range(of: "(\\d{4})(\\d{2})(\\d{2})_(\\d{2})(\\d{2})(\\d{2})", options: .regularExpression) { let dateStr = String(name[match]) - let formatter = DateFormatter() - formatter.dateFormat = "yyyyMMdd_HHmmss" - return formatter.date(from: dateStr) + return imgDateFormatter.date(from: dateStr) } // Try YYYY-MM-DD pattern if let match = name.range(of: "(\\d{4})-(\\d{2})-(\\d{2})", options: .regularExpression) { let dateStr = String(name[match]) - let formatter = DateFormatter() - formatter.dateFormat = "yyyy-MM-dd" - return formatter.date(from: dateStr) + return isoDateFormatter.date(from: dateStr) } ```

Consider pre-compiling or caching. --- `259-284`: **`mergeRules` logic could be clearer.** The nested `return group` / `return [InferredRule(...)]` pattern inside `.map` followed by `.flatMap { $0 }` is hard to follow.
üîé Proposed fix ```diff private func mergeRules(_ rules: [InferredRule]) -> [InferredRule] { // Group by pattern let grouped = Dictionary(grouping: rules) { $0.pattern } - return grouped.values.map { group in - guard let first = group.first else { return group } - - if group.count == 1 { - return group - } - - // Merge into single rule with combined examples - let mergedExampleIds = group.flatMap { $0.exampleIds } - let highestPriority = group.map { $0.priority }.max() ?? 0 - - return [InferredRule( - id: first.id, - pattern: first.pattern, - template: first.template, - metadataCues: first.metadataCues, - priority: highestPriority, - exampleIds: mergedExampleIds, - explanation: first.explanation - )] - }.flatMap { $0 } + return grouped.values.compactMap { group -> InferredRule? in + guard let first = group.first else { return nil } + + if group.count == 1 { + return first + } + + // Merge into single rule with combined examples + let mergedExampleIds = group.flatMap { $0.exampleIds } + let highestPriority = group.map { $0.priority }.max() ?? 0 + + return InferredRule( + id: first.id, + pattern: first.pattern, + template: first.template, + metadataCues: first.metadataCues, + priority: highestPriority, + exampleIds: mergedExampleIds, + explanation: first.explanation + ) + } } ```

`224-232`: **Avoid force unwrap on backupPath.** The force unwrap on `backupPath!` at line 231 is safe in this context since it's within the `if let backupDir` block, but the code would be cleaner using optional binding or guard.
üîé Suggested fix ```diff // Create backup if needed if let backupDir = backupDirectory { - backupPath = backupDir.appendingPathComponent( + let backup = backupDir.appendingPathComponent( "\(UUID().uuidString)_\(URL(fileURLWithPath: mapping.srcPath).lastPathComponent)" ).path + backupPath = backup try fm.createDirectory(at: backupDir, withIntermediateDirectories: true) - try fm.copyItem(atPath: mapping.srcPath, toPath: backupPath!) + try fm.copyItem(atPath: mapping.srcPath, toPath: backup) } ```
--- `220-258`: **Consider checking source file existence before backup/move operations.** The apply loop doesn't verify that `mapping.srcPath` exists before attempting backup and move operations. If a file was deleted after analysis, the operation will fail silently with only a generic failure count.
üîé Suggested improvement ```diff for (index, mapping) in mappingsToApply.enumerated() { do { + // Verify source file still exists + guard fm.fileExists(atPath: mapping.srcPath) else { + entries.append(JobManifestEntry( + originalPath: mapping.srcPath, + destinationPath: mapping.proposedDstPath, + status: .skipped + )) + continue + } + var backupPath: String? // Create backup if needed ```
FileSystem/FileSystemManager.swift (2)
`283-286`: **Silent failure when applying tags may cause confusion.** Using `try?` on line 285 silently ignores tag application failures. Users won't know if tags failed to apply. Consider logging failures or tracking them in the operation metadata.
üîé Suggested improvement ```diff // Apply using NSURL to avoid version check error let nsURL = fileURL as NSURL - try? nsURL.setResourceValue(finalTags, forKey: .tagNamesKey) + do { + try nsURL.setResourceValue(finalTags, forKey: .tagNamesKey) + } catch { + DebugLogger.log("Failed to apply tags to \(fileURL.path): \(error.localizedDescription)") + } ```
--- `652-654`: **Consider renaming `restoredItems` to `restorableItems` for clarity.** The property `restoredItems` contains items that *can be* restored (deleted duplicates), not items that *have been* restored. The name is misleading.
üîé Suggested rename ```diff - @Published public private(set) var restoredItems: [RestorableDuplicate] = [] + @Published public private(set) var restorableItems: [RestorableDuplicate] = [] ```
Learnings/LearningsModels.swift (1)
`127-137`: **Consider returning SwiftUI `Color` instead of `String` for `ConfidenceLevel.color`.** The `color` property returns a String ("green", "orange", "red") which requires mapping at the call site. Since this is UI-oriented, returning `SwiftUI.Color` directly would be more convenient.
üîé Suggested improvement ```diff +import SwiftUI + public enum ConfidenceLevel: String, Codable, Sendable { case high, medium, low - public var color: String { + public var color: Color { switch self { - case .high: return "green" - case .medium: return "orange" - case .low: return "red" + case .high: return .green + case .medium: return .orange + case .low: return .red } } } ``` Note: This would require importing SwiftUI, which may not be desired in a pure data model file. Alternatively, keep the String but add a separate computed property in a SwiftUI extension.
